def: Half or partially ligneous, as a stem partly woody and partlyherbaceous.
An instrument for obtaining, and transferring to a picture, thepoints and outlines of objects, so as to represent them in theirproper geometrical relations as viewed from some one point.
By way of derision; in a contemptuous or mocking manner.
A small cone or mass made of paste of gum, benzoin, cinnamon,and other aromatics, -- used for fumigating or scenting the air of aroom.
To loose the girdle or band of; to unbind; to unload.He ungirded his camels. Gen. xxiv. 32.
One who, or that which, covers.
The art or method of determining the coloring power of indigo.
Inability to utter articulate sounds, due either to paralysisof the larynx or to that form of aphasia, called motor, or ataxis,aphasia, due to loss of control of the muscles of speech.
Balanced or considered with reference to public weal. [Obs.]Shak.
